title.narrative: OECS E-Government for Regional Integration Program (APL)

description.narrative: The overall development objective of the E-Government for Regional Reform Program for Organization of Eastern Caribbean States (OECS) countries is to promote the efficiency, quality, and transparency of public services through the delivery of regionally integrated e-government applications that apply economies of scale. There are two components to the project. The first component is the horizontal e-government interventions. The objectives of this component are to strengthen and harmonize national and regional e-government processes, operational Information and Communications Technologies (ICT) platforms and frameworks; to promote more efficient regionally-based ICT development and strengthen capacity, and to provide an enabling environment to achieve public administration objectives in a globally competitive context, and to better serve citizens, businesses and consumers in the region. There are sub-components to the project. The first subcomponent is the policy and strategy implementation. This subcomponent will build on existing e-government policy and strategy development efforts, notably under European Union (EU)-funded programs. The purpose of this subcomponent is to provide assistance in specific aspects of implementation of the national e-government strategies, as well as provide support for updating and harmonizing e-government policies and strategies across the region through on-going consultation with key actors, as well as provide a framework for regional e-government cooperation activities. The second subcomponent is the regional e-government institutional framework strengthening. This subcomponent will assess the current institutional framework for e-government project implementation and technical support in the participating countries, and will provide assistance in the strengthening of the regional institutional framework for e-government. Finally, the

title.narrative: Average amount of time to process a Pharmaceuticals procurement requisition order

comment.narrative: This data is for the first, smaller procurement cycle for ARV drugs. It is to be updated for ICR following substantive procurementcycle of over 800+ items in March 2014.
This data is for the first, smaller procurement cycle for ARV drugs. It is to be updated following substantive procurement cycleof over 800+ items in March 2014.

title.narrative: Detailed design and implementation of a Multi-Purpose ID system linked to two core user agencies, including issuance of ID numbers

comment.narrative: Two points awarded to each country (giving a total of 8 points) that has successfully implemented the multipurpose ID system (onepoint) and connected it to between two core user agencies (e.g. Civil Registry and Electoral Office) (one point)

Multipurpose e-ID systems have been delivered to the countries, installed, operational, test populations have been registered andissued ID numbers. Connections between two core user agencies are pending.

title.narrative: Quality measured through focus groups by end users of the following three system: (1) eProcurement System for Pharmaceuticals; (2) eTax Filing system; (3) Multi Purpose eID system

comment.narrative: Three focus groups will be completed (and reporting will be provided) by end of February 2014.
One focus group is completed; other focus groups are in progress. Reporting on quality measured will be provided by end ofFebruary2014.

title.narrative: Number of new e-Government applications offered or upgraded under the project

comment.narrative: 1 OECS Pharmaceutical Procurement Service E-tendering System4 eTax Filing Systems4 Multi Purpose eID Systems

title.narrative: Number of persons trained in generating standard SmartStream reports

comment.narrative: DOM 6SLU 16GRE 4SVG 3

title.narrative: Total number of Tax declarations filed online through the tax e-filing system as a percentage of total tax declarations filed (VAT)

comment.narrative: Data to be submitted by Inland Revenue departments in February 2014. So far, a total of 212 submissions of tax declarations havebeen received in the four countries. Grenada has collected ~$100,000 (~EC$300,000) through the online ePayment system for the taxdeclarations.

title.narrative: Reduction of administrative costs of OECS pharmaceutical procurement

comment.narrative: Data to be submitted in February 2014.

title.narrative: Completion of standard Public Financial Management reports and SmartStream operating procedures in each country

comment.narrative: Delivery date was earlier; to be updated.

title.narrative: Percentage of population in participating EGRIP countries covered in the Multi-Purpose eID system

comment.narrative: In all countries, test populations have been registered (e.g. newborns, civil servants). Countries to submit data in February 2014.

title.narrative: Implementation of an Open Source Health Information System (HIS) for Dominica

comment.narrative: Delivery date was earlier; date to be updated.

title.narrative: Publication of an OECS e-Government regionally harmonized legislation bill, approved by the OECS Authority

comment.narrative: The OECS Authority - the body of Prime Ministers and the Chief Ministers for the OECS Member countries, approved this set ofharmonized e-Government legislation in first quarter of 2012.

title.narrative: Definition and publication of regional e-Government standards, enterprise architecture, interoperability framework and total cost of ownership documents by the OECS Secretariat

comment.narrative: The reports are all completed. Publication by OECS Secretariat is pending.

title.narrative: Regional consensus by EGRIP countries on the approval of the new institutional framework is reached at an EGRIP meeting
Regional consensus by OECS countries on a CARCIOM e-Government strategy, to which OECS countries have contributed, is reached through OECS country agreement to the strategy report at CARICOM meetings
